sys_hub_action_type_definition.annotation: appear in the flow designer view
sys_hub_action_type_definition.copied_from_name: Look Up List Item By ID
sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
Looks up a list item with both the List ID and List Item ID

Inputs:

  • Tenant - The Sharepoint tenant to perform this request against.
  • Site Location - The Relative URL path or subsite. If not specified, it will use the Tenant Root site. For example: /MyTeamSite
  • List ID - GUID/ID used for direct access to the list you'll be grabbing the item from.
  • List Item ID - The unique id within the list of the list item.

Outputs:

  • Status - Set to "Success" if the request succeeds or "Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Populated when the status is "Error".
  • Relative URL - The site URL relative from the Sharepoint Endpoint URL. For example: /sites/mySite/NewSubSite
  • Item Created - Date/Time (UTC) of when the list item was created
  • Item Modified - Date/Time (UTC) of when the list item was last modified
  • Item Title - Should be a required field on all lists, and retrieves this information.

Error Messages:

  • List Item not found
  • Incorrectly formatted request

To use this action, the corresponding Sharepoint Online connection and credential must be created and associated with the Sharepoint Online Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires an IntegrationHub subscription for production use. Read More.
sys_hub_action_type_definition.name: Look Up IAM Record By ID

sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.description:
Looks up a list item with both the List ID and List Item ID

Inputs:

  • Tenant - The Sharepoint tenant to perform this request against.
  • Site Location - The Relative URL path or subsite. If not specified, it will use the Tenant Root site. For example: /MyTeamSite
  • List ID - GUID/ID used for direct access to the list you'll be grabbing the item from.
  • List Item ID - The unique id within the list of the list item.

Outputs:

  • Status - Set to "Success" if the request succeeds or "Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Populated when the status is "Error".
  • Relative URL - The site URL relative from the Sharepoint Endpoint URL. For example: /sites/mySite/NewSubSite
  • Item Created - Date/Time (UTC) of when the list item was created
  • Item Modified - Date/Time (UTC) of when the list item was last modified
  • Item Title - Should be a required field on all lists, and retrieves this information.

Error Messages:

  • List Item not found
  • Incorrectly formatted request

To use this action, the corresponding Sharepoint Online connection and credential must be created and associated with the Sharepoint Online Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires an IntegrationHub subscription for production use. Read More.
